column4: i am getting an error from vbox The VirtualBox kernel driver is not accessible to the current user. Make sure that the user has write permissions for /dev/vboxdrv by adding them to the vboxusers groups. You will need to logout for the change to take effect..
you have to add your username to the vboxusers group
scroll to the vboxusers group, and click properties, then put a checkmark next to your username
lmao, well um, i don't know what to to tell you
were you planning on running ubuntu inside the vbox?  why would you ask that in an ubuntu chat?
so how can i add to suse
i have no idea.  i'm sure that's pretty easy to find in suse documentation
in suse, go to "Control Center" then "user management"
then it should be pretty close to teh same, look look at the groups, find vboxusers, and add your username to it
i am looking in groups there are no vbox users there
well, that's unfortunate.  i've never run into that issue
but i doubt it will have the correct security rights for running vbox
